title: Heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: The low-level atmospheric disturbance in the Bay of Bengal, to the southeast of the Sri Lanka has intensified into a low-pressure area, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: New Bill submitted to Parliament to address microfinance loan issues
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) Parliamentarian Lakshman Nipuna Arachchi has announced that a new bill has been submitted to Parliament with the objective of addressing the persistent issues associated with microfinance loans.

title: Father, daughter killed in house fire; Four others hospitalized
byline: A father and his daughter have been reported dead, while four other family members were hospitalized with burn injuries after a fire broke out in a home at Galenbindunuwewa, Anuradhapura, police said.

title: Organized criminal gang member arrested with firearms and heroin
byline: A member of an organized criminal gang has been arrested during a special operation carried out by the Police Special Task Force (STF).

title: Trump administration sets meetings with oil companies over Venezuela, source says
byline: The administration of President Donald Trump is planning to meet with executives from U.S. oil companies later this week to discuss boosting Venezuelan oil production after U.S. forces ousted its leader Nicolas Maduro, according to a source familiar with the matter.

title: Parliament to convene today for first sitting of 2026
byline: Parliament is scheduled to convene today (06) for the first time this year.

title: GMOA to consider actions over unresolved health sector issues tomorrow
byline: A special Central Committee meeting of the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) is scheduled to be held tomorrow (07) to discuss possible actions in response to the government’s failure to intervene and address issues affecting the health sector.

title: Ousted Maduro pleads not guilty to US drug charges
byline: Toppled Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro pleaded not guilty on Monday to narcotics charges after President Donald Trump’s stunning capture of him rattled world leaders and left officials in Caracas scrambling to regroup.

title: Strong magnitude 6.2 earthquake strikes Japan’s Chugoku region
byline: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.2 hit the western Chugoku region of Japan on Tuesday, followed by a series of sizeable aftershocks, the Japan Meteorological Agency said.

title: Shots fired near Venezuela presidential palace: Witnesses
byline: Shots were fired late on Monday (Jan 5) near Venezuela’s presidential palace, witnesses said, days after United States forces captured the now-deposed President Nicolas Maduro in a military raid.

title: Venezuela swears in interim president after defiant Maduro pleads not guilty
byline: Delcy Rodríguez was sworn in as Venezuela’s interim president in a parliamentary session that began with demands for the release of ousted leader Nicolás Maduro from US custody.

title: Nuwara Eliya temperature drops to 14°C, 173 mm rainfall recorded in Lahugala
byline: The lowest temperature in Sri Lanka today (06) was recorded from the Nuwara Eliya Meteorological Station as 14.2 degrees Celsius, according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Opposition requests chairmanship of committee probing Cyclone ‘Ditwah’ preparedness
byline: The Chief Opposition Whip, Gayantha Karunathilaka, today requested in Parliament that the chairmanship of the Special Committee, proposed to be appointed to investigate the lack of preparedness for Cyclone ‘Ditwah,’ be assigned to the opposition.

title: Five dead after consuming suspected illicit liquor in Waikkala
byline: A total of five individuals have reportedly died in Waikkala, Wennappuwa, following the suspected consumption of illicit liquor.

title: Six fishermen arrested with over 850kg of shark meat
byline: A total of six fishermen have been arrested along with over 850 kilograms of illegally harvested shark fish meat during a special search operation conducted today (6) by the Sri Lanka Coast Guard.

title: Cabinet greenlights 2026–2030 National Strategic Action Plan on human trafficking
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal to implement the National Strategic Action Plan to Combat Trafficking in Persons for the period 2026–2030.

title: Cabinet approves proposal to expand dialysis services under PPP model
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal to expand dialysis services at government hospitals through a Public-Private Partnership (PPP) mechanism, in view of the growing demand for renal care services across the country.

title: Low-pressure area set to intensify into depression during the next 24 hours
byline: The low-pressure area in the Bay of Bengal, to the southeast of Sri Lanka is likely to intensify into a depression during the next 24 hours, the Department of Meteorology has warned.

title: Landslide disrupts traffic on Welimada–Maspanna road following heavy rainfall
byline: A landslide has occurred in Bambarapana along the Welimada–Maspanna road due to continuous rainfall.

title: Pulathisi Intercity and Ella Odyssey train services to resume
byline: The Railway Department has announced the resumption of the Pulathisi Intercity Train service, with operations scheduled to recommence from January 9, 2026.

title: Gold prices in Sri Lanka surge amid global tensions
byline: Gold prices continue to rise globally following the U.S.’s capturing of the Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.

title: Over 700 arrested in nationwide special police operations
byline: The police have identified a total of 27 individuals directly involved in various criminal activities as part of a special nationwide crime and drug prevention operation.

title: Galenbindunuwewa House Fire: Death toll rises as suspect’s wife dies
byline: The death toll from the tragic house fire in Galenbindunuwewa has risen to three following the passing of the suspect’s wife while undergoing treatment.

title: Election law violation case against ex-Minister Harin Fernando adjourned
byline: Former Minister Harin Fernando has appeared before the Badulla Magistrate’s Court this morning (6 January) in connection with an ongoing case concerning alleged violations of election laws during the last General Election.

title: The ‘magical’ blue flower changing farmers’ fortunes in India
byline: “Until a few years ago, the butterfly pea flower was just another climbing plant in my village,” says Nilam Brahma who lives in Anthaigwlao, a village in the northeastern Indian state of Assam.

title: A new Grammy category honors album covers, and the artists that make them
byline: When it came time to decide the cover image for Wet Leg’s sophomore album, the British indie rock band packed items that might provide inspiration — velvet worms sewn by guitarist Hester Chambers, an oversized head of hair from a music video shoot, lizard-like gloves — and headed to an Airbnb.

title: Tomorrowland to hold its first-ever Asia festival in Thailand
byline: Tomorrowland, the hugely popular European electronic dance music or EDM festival, will stage its first-ever full-fledged Asia edition in Thailand this December.

title: Landslide evacuation warning issued to several areas in Central Province
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued a level 3 ‘Red’ landslide evacuation warning for three areas in two districts within the Central Province.

title: Major Titanic exhibition set for Liverpool in 2026
byline: A major Titanic exhibition is set to come to Liverpool in 2026.

title: Three Indian nationals arrested at BIA with ‘Kush cannabis’ worth Rs. 500 mn
byline: Three Indian nationals have been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) with 50kg of ‘Kush cannabis’.

title: Several roads in Galle submerged due to heavy rains
byline: A number of roads in Galle have been flooded due to heavy rainfall in the area.

title: Govt. to use key diagnostic equipment services via PPP to enhance diagnosis of non-communicable diseases
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to take necessary steps to acquire services and equipment to diagnose non-communicable diseases, following the accepted procurement procedure under the suitable public-private partnership (PPP) subject to a performance based payment scheme.

title: Govt to strengthen Thriposha programme through high-quality maize-based food system
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to proceed with the implementation of a project aimed at building a resilient, high-quality maize-based food system to enhance the Thriposha programme in Sri Lanka.

title: Sri Lanka Police launch special traffic monitoring strategies for 2026
byline: Sri Lanka Police have launched special traffic monitoring strategies for 2026 to curb the rising number of road accidents and to improve public safety in the country, Police Media Spokesman ASP F.U. Wootler said.

title: Private entity given five-year contract to supply vehicle number plates for DMT
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the proposal presented by the Minister of Transport, Highways, and Urban Development to award a contract to the M/s South Asian Technologies for the printing and supplying vehicle number plates for the Department of Motor Traffic for a period of five years.

title: Zelenskyy appoints ex-Canadian deputy premier as economic adviser
byline: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday signed a decree appointing former Canadian Deputy Prime Minister Chrystia Freeland as an adviser on economic development.

title: Hyundai to deploy humanoid robots at US factory from 2028
byline: Hyundai Motor Group plans to deploy humanoid robots at its US manufacturing plant in Georgia starting in 2028, marking a step toward automating higher-risk and repetitive manufacturing tasks, the South Korean company says.

title: Defence Ministry holds legal awareness programme on Proceeds of Crime Act
byline: A special awareness programme on the Proceeds of Crime Act, No. 5 of 2025, was conducted today (06) at the Ministry of Defence, aimed at educating the security and legal leadership on the complexities of illicit wealth recovery.

title: Swiss ski bar blaze: No fire safety inspection in 5 years, sparklers prohibited
byline: Swiss officials have admitted that the ski resort bar where a New Year’s fire killed 40 people had not been checked for fire safety for five years, as authorities moved to ban sparklers from all local venues amid mounting public anger and grief.

title: Resolution to appoint Select Committee to choose suitable electoral system to conduct PC elections presented to Parliament
byline: The resolution to appoint a Select Committee of Parliament to look into and report to Parliament on the matter of selecting the electoral system under which the Provincial Council Elections should be held and submit its proposals and recommendations has been presented in Parliament.

title: “Makes world less safe”: UN slams US intervention in Venezuela
byline: The world community must make clear that US intervention in Venezuela is a violation of international law that makes the world less safe, the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights said on Tuesday.

title: Chairman of NPP-held Balangoda Urban Council resigns
byline: K.G. Premadasa, the Chairman of the Balangoda Urban Council representing the National People’s Power, has resigned from his position.

title: Citizens should fulfill their responsibilities to eradicate the drug menace from Sri Lanka: President
byline: Just as the country’s physical development is important, the wellbeing and stability of society are equally vital, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has emphasized.

title: Three Indian nationals arrested at BIA with ‘Kush cannabis’ valued at Rs. 500 mn
byline: Three Indian nationals have been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) with 50kg of ‘Kush cannabis’.

title: Stock of explosives including RPGs recovered in Vakarai
byline: A stock of explosives has been recovered in the Vakarai area of Batticaloa by the Police Special Task Force (STF) today (06).

title: Nvidia launches Vera Rubin, its next major AI platform, at CES 2026
byline: AI powerhouse Nvidia (NVDA) announced the launch of its next-generation Vera Rubin superchip at CES 2026 on Monday in Las Vegas. One of six chips that make up what Nvidia is now calling its Rubin platform, Vera Rubin combines one Vera CPU and two Rubin GPUs in a single processor.

title: Deadline to submit applications to serve as O/L exam examiners ends on Thursday
byline: The deadline to submit applications to serve as examiners of answer scripts for the General Certificate of Education (Ordinary Level) Examination 2025 (2026) will conclude on Thursday (08), the Department of Examinations has announced.

title: Maha Bodhi Society of India donates Rs. 10 million to ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund
byline: The Maha Bodhi Society of India has made a financial contribution of Rs. 10 million to the ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund, the President’s Media Division stated.

title: Resolution to appoint Select Committee to identify suitable electoral system for PC elections in Parliament
byline: The resolution to appoint a Select Committee of Parliament to look into and report to Parliament on selecting the electoral system under which the Provincial Council Elections should be held and submit its proposals and recommendations has been presented in Parliament.

title: Authorities prepare for possible severe weather as low-pressure area strengthens
byline: All necessary preparations have been made to face any possible disaster situations that may arise in the future, according to the Director of the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) Pradeep Kodippili.

title: Private entity granted five-year contract to supply vehicle number plates for DMT
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the proposal to award a contract to the M/s South Asian Technologies for the printing and supplying vehicle number plates for the Department of Motor Traffic for a period of five years.

title: European leaders voice support for Denmark after Trump claims on Greenland
byline: A group of European leaders on Tuesday (Jan 6) underlined their support for Denmark after US President Donald Trump again voiced designs on its autonomous Arctic territory of Greenland.

title: Govt. to acquire services and equipment to enhance diagnosis of non-communicable diseases
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal to take necessary steps to acquire services and equipment to diagnose non-communicable diseases under the suitable public-private partnership (PPP) subject to a performance based payment scheme.

title: Four Sri Lankans arrested at BIA with forged Polish visas
byline: Four Sri Lankans returning from New Delhi, India, after traveling to obtain visas required to migrate to Poland, have been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), with fraudulently prepared visas.
